title: Tanks should get a "size" stat that increases their model size.
body:
Imagine if a handful of tank items had 10-25% "size" on them.

Why you ask? Well...

* Many tank skills radiate FROM the tank. (Naut's Riptide. Sejuani's flail. Amumu's crying) Increasing their size buffs how much damage they can do without increasing their raw power.
* Tanks want to take hits and be frontline. Increasing size makes it easier to click them as well as absorb skillshots.
* Increasing size makes it easier to click ADCs/fighters as well, making tank items less desireable for them.
* Size conversely also makes you take more damage. Not a big deal if you have a lot of defensive items. However, if you're 50% bigger with one tank item, it's not nearly as good.

Overall, it would buff tanks who WANT to take hits and make items more desireable for them while nerfing people who could abuse tank items and make things like tank ekko/tank diana less desireable.

I foresee problems with champions fitting through the most narrow bushes if you could stack size large enough. You can already get pretty massive {{champion:31}} {{champion:117}} {{item:2138}} {{item:3053}} .

>Many tank skills radiate FROM the tank. (Naut's Riptide. Sejuani's flail. Amumu's crying) Increasing their size buffs how much damage they can do without increasing their raw power.

In my experience that's not actually how Flail of the Northern Winds works. It has a set range away from Sejuani's centre, if you have an Elixir of Iron you actually  need to be a little closer to enemies to deal damage to them. It matters less by the time you get EoI because you're typically level 18 and have ranks in Q and E, so you can stick ontop of a target better but if you were to buy it before you get your sticking tools it would hinder you.

That's not to say size wouldn't help Sejuani in any way, you would gain a little bit of range on the W hit but I doubt it would be worth what you'd lose on W ticks from being too large to apply them properly.

As it stands though, I'd avoid large size increases from items. I can play around EoI since it's so late and the other choices aren't great but I wouldn't actually want to be pumping up my size too much, the smaller I am the more W range I actually have to work with. If this was changed to work the way you thought it did, sure but as it stands I'd stick to whatever doesn't make me bigger, or something that makes me smaller if possible.
